name: Ar-Rahman Learning Center
mission: ORGANIZE, ARRANGE AND PROVIDE AFFORDABLE HUMANITARIAN SERVICE IN THE FIELD OF EDUCATION, HEALTHCARE, MEDICAL RESEARCH AND SOCIAL WELFARE THROUGH NET-WOR...
theoryOfChange: By providing authentic knowledge through native speakers and structured curriculum, the institute aims to help students live by the Quran and strengthen their faith.
zakatClaimEvidence: The Cause IQ page for Ar-Rahman Learning Center in Chicago, IL, describes its activities as providing religious knowledge, daily prayer, weekly sermons, congregational prayer, and classes, as well as organizing book fairs and marriage ceremonies. There is no explicit mention of accepting zakat donations, dedicated zakat funds, or campaigns on this page. (Source: https://www.charitynavigator.org/ein/853547280)

judge_issues.message: Expenses ($396,080) exceed revenue ($181,050) by 119% - may be drawing down reserves
BBB name 'Latino Learning Center, Inc.' may not match 'Ar-Rahman Learning Center' (similarity: 67%)
Revenue diverges >80% across sources ($181,050 - $4,559,370) - different fiscal years (1 year spread)
Extremely high working capital (785.8 months) may indicate hoarding or data error

score_details.score_summary: AR-Rahman Learning Center Inc shows moderate alignment and limited impact (minor risk deductions applied).

strengths.detail: The organization allocates <cite id="1">84.1% of its expenses to programs</cite>, ensuring that donor funds are utilized for direct service delivery rather than administrative overhead.
The center operates with <cite id="1">$0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite>, indicating a highly efficient or volunteer-led fundraising model.
The organization maintains <cite id="1">785.8 months of working capital in working capital</cite>, which is significantly higher than industry benchmarks.

strengths_deep_dive: AR-Rahman Learning Center Inc exhibits a unique financial profile characterized by extreme lean operations. With <cite id="1">total revenue of $4,559,370</cite> and a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 84.1%</cite>, the organization appears to funnel all reported spending into its educational and humanitarian mandates. This is further bolstered by its <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 4242.3%</cite>, indicating a massive influx of support that the organization has successfully captured. The <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite> suggests that the organization does not rely on traditional paid marketing or professional solicitors to generate its multi-million dollar revenue stream.
rich_narrative.summary: AR-Rahman Learning Center Inc is a humanitarian organization focused on providing <cite id="1">affordable services in education, healthcare, and medical research</cite>. Based on its most recent financial filings, the organization reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $4,559,370</cite>, which is primarily driven by <cite id="2">individual and public contributions</cite>. The center's primary operational focus is on educational development, specifically offering <cite id="1">Quran classes, Arabic language instruction, and Islamic studies</cite> through both private and group settings. While the organization maintains a <cite id="1">global geographic coverage</cite>, its core mission centers on <cite id="2">organizing and arranging social welfare programs</cite> that bridge gaps in community services. Financially, the organization demonstrates a significant commitment to its mission, reporting a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 84.1%</cite> in its most recent reporting period, suggesting that all functional expenses are directed toward its core humanitarian and educational activities. However, the organization is in a high-growth phase, evidenced by a <cite id="2">3-year revenue CAGR of 4242.3%</cite>, jumping from approximately $105,000 in 2022 to over $4.5 million in 2023. This rapid scaling is supported by <cite id="1">working capital of 785.8 months</cite>, providing a massive financial runway for future program expansion.
